title: Slightly excessive "normal operation" logging

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

body:
### What happened?

I have ~20 synced folders on my home "server" (a few large ones and many little single-purpose folders like "sync WoW addons"). They're all on default hourly scan. But with 20 of them it naturally adds up, so with Syncthing 2.0.x I am now getting three "Folder changed state" messages practically every minute (`scan-waiting` → `scanning` → `idle`) – probably 1/3rd of all system logs since reboot are just Syncthing informing verbosely about its periodic rescans. I'm wondering if these messages are really necessary, or if I'm holding Syncthing the wrong way.

### Syncthing version

v2.0.3

### Platform & operating system

Linux x86_64

### Browser version

_No response_
